title.narrative: PACT Promot. citizen engagement in Democratic Development in Cambodia, 2016-2018
PACT Ökat medborgligt deltagande i decentraliseringsprocess i Kambodja 2016-2018

description.narrative: PROCEED II aims to contribute to the following project goal: "Sub-national administrations are more accountable to diverse citizens". The programme has two main outcomes: - Diverse citizen groups more effectively voice their needs and feedback to influence sub-national administration decisions. - Sub-national administrations address more citizen issues. The results framework follows the theory of change presented by Pact and remains consistent with the approach of the previous programme phase, PROCEED I.

Pact Institute har till Sida ansökt om finansiering för 15 miljoner kronor för att genomföra projektet "Promoting Citizen Engagement in Democratic Development, phase II (PROCEED II)" i Kambodja under perioden februari 2016 - oktober 2018. PROCEED II är en fortsättning på ett tidigare fas genomförd av Pact och med finansiering från Sida.
Projektets långsiktiga mål är att bidra till att lokala myndigheter blir mer ansvarstagande gentemot medborgarna. Direkt syftar projektet till att nå två delmål: 1) olika medborgargrupper för mer effektivt fram sina behov och åsikter gentemot sina lokala myndigheter 2) lokala myndigheter hanterar fler frågor från medborgarna. Pact kommer att genomföra projektet tillsammans med fem lokala organisationer i Kambodja som i sin tur stödjer organisationer och individer på gräsrotsnivå. Geografiskt kommer projektet att genomföras i fyra provinser och tolv distrikt. Pact kommer också att stödja ett nätverk på nationell nivå i syfte att förbättra dialogen mellan det civila samhället och den kambodjanska regeringen avseende landets decentraliseringsreform.

Pact Institute has applied to Sida for funding of 15 million SEK to carry out the project "Promoting Citizen Engagement in Democratic Development, phase II (PROCEED II)" in Cambodia during the period February 2016 - October 2018. PROCEED II is a continuation of an earlier phase implemented by the Pact and with financing from Sida.
The intervention overall goal is to contribute to sub-national administrations to be more accountable to diverse citizens. In doing so, the project aims at reaching two main objectives: 1) diverse citizen groups more effectively voice their needs and feedback to influence sub-national administration decisions 2) sub-national administrations address more citizen issues. Pact will implement the project together with five local NGOs in Cambodia who in their turn support community based organisations, grass-root organisations and individuals across four provinces and twelve district/municipalities. Pact will also support one network on national level in order to improve the civil society dialogue with the government on the Cambodian decentralisation reform.

sector.narrative: Decentralisation and support to subnational government

tag.narrative: 16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The results framework follows the theory of change presented by Pact and remains consistent with the approach of the previous programme phase, PROCEED I implemented 2012-2016. PROCEED II was implemented during 2016-2018. The results presented are compiled from two complementary endline assessments, the final report, an independently conducted quantitative survey, and an internally implemented qualitative assessment as well as the financial statement for the project period 2016-2018. The audit report has been assessed separately. Remaining funds and accrued interest have been repaid. The overall assessment is that PROCEED II, 2016-2018, has achieved its intended outcome of promoting, supporting and engaging citizens in 12 districts with local government representatives with the aim to hold administrators more accountable and responsive to citizens. The project has worked with both the demand side and the supply side with some unexpected additional outcome on the supply side.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
